ygData.subject: Re: agil or dex?
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, Wood Elf Bards and Half Elf Bards start with the same Charisma (85) if unmodified by the user.  I think the Half Elf starts with higher stats or more
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, Wood Elf Bards and Half Elf Bards start with the same Charisma
(85) if unmodified by the user. I think the Half Elf starts with higher
stats or more points overall, but I prefer the benefit of being able to wear
small and medium armor better.

When I started my bard, I put most of my points in STR and CHA, weighing a
bit towards charisma. I just always have pictured a bard as being
charismatic, able to "wow" the crowds with stories and song. And I chose to
raise STR since it seems so combat oriented, and I wanted to be able to do
SOMETHING in combat. (smile). Also, I know it determines your weight
capacity, so I also wanted to be able to carry lots of stuff (packhorse
mentality) and after getting full set of bronze and all the other stuff I
haul around, I am glad I did!

Tim - Tallonn - Bertox

>i play a wood elf, the biggest advantage being that you can wear small or
>medium armor. plus i like to melee, i like to play a battle bard, so i put
>all of my points in to strength. with my enhancing items i am currently at
>113 strength, 102 agility, and 101 dexterity. so the points will come with
>items as you get them. also being a wood elf, you can wear all small
bronze
>or steel plate, which weighs less. as far as dexterity, i don't know if it
>has to do with playing instruments, but it allows you to miss less when
>meleeing (right? hehe), and yes agility allows you to get hit less. i
think
>the biggest factor with playing instruments is merely your skill level with
>that instrument. the last stat you have to think of is charisma helping
>your charm spell last longer, and some say your songs get resisted less. i
>believe a wood elf starts with higher charisma than a half elf.
>
>Shada Silverleaf, Level 47 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
